metadata.Title: CVE-2013-2099 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.Description:
Algorithmic complexity vulnerability in the ssl.match_hostname function inPython 3.2.x, 3.3.x, and earlier, and unspecified versions ofpython-backports-ssl_match_hostname as used for older Python versions,allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) viamultiple wildcard characters in the common name in a certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bzr - 2.6.0~bzr6574-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

linkchecker - 8.6-2
linkchecker-web - 8.6-2
No subscription required

python3-tornado - 3.2.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

python3-urllib3 - 1.6-2
No subscription required

0install - 2.3.3-1
0install-core - 2.3.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bzr package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.0~bzr6574-1ubuntu1').
linkchecker package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.6-2').
python-tornado package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.0-1ubuntu1').
python-urllib3 package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6-2').
zeroinstall-injector package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.3-1').
